pages.title: Tesla Coil
pages.text: The <item>Tesla Coil/$ is a way of transmitting <thing>Forge Energy (FE)/$. There are two parts: The base, and the top. The <item>Tesla Coil/$ (AKA the base) connects to machines and transfers FE. It accepts FE on the <em>blue/$ sides and bottom, and outputs FE on the <em>orange/$ side.$(br2)

The <item>Tesla Coil Top/$ is placed on top of the base, and transmits FE between <item>tesla coils/$. Use a <item>$(l:essentials/linking_tool)linking tool/$ to connect the source <item>tesla coil top/$ to the <item>tesla coil top(s)/$ it should transmit to.$(br2)Transmitting FE this way has a small energy loss. Later on, there are special tops that can improve this.$(br2)

A redstone signal will stop it from outputting FE- either by firing electric arcs from the top, or by outputting from the base. <thing>$(l:essentials/circuits#reader)Reader circuits/$ measure the total stored FE.$(br2)

A <item>leyden jar/$ is a 'battery' that can be placed into a <item>tesla coil base/$ to increase FE capacity. The <item>leyden jar/$ is removed by shift-right-clicking with an empty hand on the base, and maintains its FE charge when removed.$(br2)
